intro: Chrysosplenium alternifolium var. cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf goldcup, is a member of the Saxifragaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. The species is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and is often found in cool, temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
